Package jetbrains.exodus.env

Interface Cursor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    public interface Cursor
extends java.io.Closeable
    Cursor allows to access key/value pairs of a Store in both successive (ascending and descending) and random order. Cursor can be opened for a Store in a Transaction. Both key (getKey()) and value (getValue()) are accessible as ByteIterable instances. Finally, any cursor should always be closed.

    Each newly created cursor points to a "virtual" key/value pair which is prior to the first (leftmost) pair. Use getNext() to move to the first and getPrev() to last (rightmost) key/value pair. You can move Cursor to the last (rightmost) position from any other position using getLast().

    See Also:
    Store, Store.openCursor(Transaction)

    • Method Detail

      • getNext

        boolean getNext()
        Moves the Cursor to the next key/value pair. If the Cursor is just created the method moves it to the first (leftmost) key/value pair.

        E.g., traversing all key/value pairs of a Store in ascending order looks as follows: 

         try (Cursor cursor = store.openCursor(txn)) {
     while (cursor.getNext()) {
         cursor.getKey();   // current key
         cursor.getValue(); // current value
     }
 }
        Returns:
        true if next pair exists
        See Also:
        getNextDup(), getNextNoDup(), getPrev(), getPrevDup(), getPrevNoDup()

      • getNextDup

        boolean getNextDup()
        Moves the Cursor to the next key/value pair with the same key.
        Returns:
        true if next pair with the same key exists
        See Also:
        getNext(), getNextNoDup(), getPrev(), getPrevDup(), getPrevNoDup()

      • getNextNoDup

        boolean getNextNoDup()
        Moves the Cursor to the next key/value pair with the nearest key different from current one.
        Returns:
        true if next pair exists
        See Also:
        getNext(), getNextDup(), getPrev(), getPrevDup(), getPrevNoDup()

      • getLast

        boolean getLast()
        Moves the Cursor to the last (rightmost) key/value pair if any exists. Returns true if the Store has at least one key/value pair.
        Returns:
        true if the Cursor points to the last key/value pair
        See Also:
        getNext(), getNextDup(), getNextNoDup(), getPrev(), getPrevDup(), getPrevNoDup()

      • getPrev

        boolean getPrev()
        Moves the Cursor to the previous key/value pair. If the Cursor is just created the method moves it to the last (rightmost) key/value pair.

        E.g., traversing all key/value pairs of a Store in descending order looks as follows: 

         try (Cursor cursor = store.openCursor(txn)) {
     while (cursor.getPrev()) {
         cursor.getKey();   // current key
         cursor.getValue(); // current value
     }
 }
        Returns:
        true if previous pair exists
        See Also:
        getNext(), getNextDup(), getNextNoDup(), getPrevDup(), getPrevNoDup()

      • getPrevDup

        boolean getPrevDup()
        Moves the Cursor to the previous key/value pair with the same key.
        Returns:
        true if previous pair with the same key exists
        See Also:
        getNext(), getNextDup(), getNextNoDup(), getPrev(), getPrevNoDup()

      • getPrevNoDup

        boolean getPrevNoDup()
        Moves the Cursor to the previous key/value pair with the nearest key different from current one.
        Returns:
        true if previous pair exists
        See Also:
        getNext(), getNextDup(), getNextNoDup(), getPrev(), getPrevDup()

@NotNull ByteIterable getValue()
        Returns:
        current value
        See Also:

      • getSearchKey

        @Nullable
@Nullable ByteIterable getSearchKey​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull ByteIterable key)
        Moves the Cursor to the specified key, and returns the value associated with the key. In stores with key duplicates, if the matching key has duplicate values, the Cursor moves to the first (leftmost) key/value pair.

        If the method fails for any reason, it returns null, and the position of the Cursor will be unchanged.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for
        Returns:
        first (leftmost) value associated with the key or null if no such value exists
        See Also:
        getSearchKeyRange(ByteIterable), getSearchBoth(ByteIterable, ByteIterable), getSearchBothRange(ByteIterable, ByteIterable)

      • getSearchKeyRange

        @Nullable
@Nullable ByteIterable getSearchKeyRange​(@NotNull
                                         @NotNull ByteIterable key)
        Moves the Cursor to the first pair in the Store whose key is equal to or greater than the specified key. It returns not-null value if it succeeds or null if nothing is found, and the position of the Cursor will be unchanged.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for
        Returns:
        not-null value if it succeeds or null if nothing is found
        See Also:
        getSearchKey(ByteIterable), getSearchBoth(ByteIterable, ByteIterable), getSearchBothRange(ByteIterable, ByteIterable)

      • getSearchBoth

        boolean getSearchBoth​(@NotNull
                      @NotNull ByteIterable key,
                      @NotNull
                      @NotNull ByteIterable value)
        Moves the Cursor to the key/value pair with the specified key and value and returns true if the pair exists in the Store. Otherwise the position of the Cursor will be unchanged.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for
        value - the value to search for
        Returns:
        true if the pair with the specified key and value exists in the Store
        See Also:
        getSearchKey(ByteIterable), getSearchKeyRange(ByteIterable), getSearchBothRange(ByteIterable, ByteIterable)

      • getSearchBothRange

        @Nullable
@Nullable ByteIterable getSearchBothRange​(@NotNull
                                          @NotNull ByteIterable key,
                                          @NotNull
                                          @NotNull ByteIterable value)
        Moves the Cursor to the first pair in the Store whose key matches the specified key and whose value is equal to or greater than the specified value. If the Store supports key duplicates, then on matching the key, the Cursor is moved to the duplicate pair with the smallest value that is equal to or greater than the specified value. Like the getSearchKeyRange(ByteIterable) method, it returns not-null value if it succeeds or null if nothing is found, and the position of the Cursor will be unchanged.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for
        value - the value to search for
        Returns:
        not-null value if it succeeds or null if nothing is found
        See Also:
        getSearchKey(ByteIterable), getSearchKeyRange(ByteIterable), getSearchBoth(ByteIterable, ByteIterable)

      • count

        int count()
        Returns:
        the number of values in the Store associated with current key

      • isMutable

        boolean isMutable()
        Cursor is mutable if it is created in a transaction which has dirty (not flushed/committed) modifications. Mutable cursors automatically pick up changes made using Store.add(Transaction, ByteIterable, ByteIterable), Store.put(Transaction, ByteIterable, ByteIterable) and Store.delete(Transaction, ByteIterable) methods.
        Returns:
        true if cursor is mutable

      • close

        void close()
        This method should always be called as immediately as possible to avoid unnecessary performance degradation.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable

      • deleteCurrent

        boolean deleteCurrent()
        Deletes current key/value pair in the Store and returns true if deletion succeeded.
        Returns:
        true if current key/value pair was deleted
